de.pifpafpuf.web.html

Class FormattingHtml

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.pifpafpuf.web.html.EmptyElem
      • de.pifpafpuf.web.html.FormattingHtml
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Html

    public abstract class FormattingHtml
extends EmptyElem

    base class for HTML elements with children. This class does not store or handle children, it only knows how to output them in a pretty fashion. The general class with child elements is Html.

    Applications using this library will define application specific subclasses with, for example, a fixed number of child elements of a possibly fixed type. Examples could be page header, or a repeatedly used UI element like a button or a type of list.

    • Method Detail

      • setTight

        public void setTight(boolean tight)
        requests tight or indented output of this HTML element. The children of this element are printed out inside the element's tags without any additional whitespace like line breaks and indentation in tight mode. Tightness is inherited by all children.

      • getChildren

        protected abstract Iterable<Stringable> getChildren()

        subclasses must provide the children for the benefit of print(java.lang.Appendable, int).

        Returns:
        the children managed by the subclass

      • print

        public final void print(Appendable out,
         int indent)
                 throws IOException
        locked against overriding, because without this method, this class has no service to offer. If you feel you need to override this method, derive directly from EmptyElem instead.
        Specified by:
        print in interface Stringable
        Overrides:
        print in class EmptyElem
        Parameters:
        out - is the stream to append the text to
        indent - must be used right after line breaks inserted
        Throws:
        IOException
